intro: Adenocalymma gracielzae, commonly known as the Cape York daisy, is a flowering plant native to northern Australia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae and is characterized by its small, white to pinkish flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. It has narrow, linear leaves and produces small, capsule-like fruits. Adenocalymma gracielzae is often found in open woodlands and is an important component of the local flora.
